item.title: Jessica add a quote by Graham Greene
item.description: "Writing is a form of therapy; sometimes I wonder how all those who do not write, compose, or paint can manage to escape the madness, melancholia, the panic and fear which is inherent in a human situation." -- Graham Greene

item.title: Jessica add a quote by Thomas Ligotti
item.description: "To my mind, a well-developed sense of humor is the surest indication of a person's humanity, no matter how black and bitter that humor may be." -- Thomas Ligotti

item.title: Jessica add a quote by Henri Matisse
item.description: "We ought to view ourselves with the same curiosity and openness with which we study a tree, the sky or a thought, because we too are linked to the entire universe. " -- Henri Matisse

item.title: Jessica add a quote by Louise Bourgeois
item.description: "It is not so much where my motivation comes from but rather how it manages to survive." -- Louise Bourgeois

item.title: Jessica add a quote by Isak Dinesen
Jessica add a quote by Eden Phillpotts
item.description: "The universe is full of magical things patiently waiting for our wits to grow sharper." -- Eden Phillpotts

item.title: Jessica add a quote by Marguerite Duras
item.description: "Very early in my life it was too late." -- Marguerite Duras

item.title: Jessica add a quote by Ogden Nash
item.description: "The door of a bigoted mind opens outwards so that the only result of the pressure of facts upon it is to close it more snugly." -- Ogden Nash

item.title: Jessica add a quote by Yahia Lababidi
item.description: "We all have handicaps. The difference is that some of us must reveal ours, while others must conceal theirs, to be treated with mercy." -- Yahia Lababidi

item.title: Jessica add a quote by Virginia Woolf
item.description: "You cannot find peace by avoiding life." -- Virginia Woolf

item.title: Jessica add a quote by Marilyn Monroe
item.description: "Imperfection is beauty, madness is genius and it's better to be absolutely ridiculous than absolutely boring." -- Marilyn Monroe

item.title: Jessica add a quote by Robert Burns
item.description: "Then gently scan your brother man, still gentler sister woman, though they may gang a kennin wrang, to step aside is human" -- Robert Burns

item.title: Jessica add a quote by Arthur C. Clarke
item.description: "The only way of discovering the limits of the possible is to venture a little way past them into the impossible." -- Arthur C. Clarke

item.title: Jessica add a quote by J.G. Ballard
item.description: "Civilised life, you know, is based on a huge number of illusions in which we all collaborate willingly. The trouble is we forget after a while that they are illusions and we are deeply shocked when reality is torn down around us." -- J.G. Ballard

item.title: Jessica add a quote by Tennessee Williams
item.description: "A high station in life is earned by the gallantry with which appalling experiences are survived with grace." -- Tennessee Williams

item.title: Jessica add a quote by Henry Beston
item.description: "<i>We need another and a wiser and perhaps a more mystical concept of animals. In a world older and more complete than ours they move finished and complete, gifted with extensions of the senses we have lost or never attained, living by voices we shall never hear. They are not brethren, they are not underlings; they are other nations, caught with ourselves in the net of life and time, fellow prisoners of the splendour and travail of the earth.</i>" -- Henry Beston

item.title: Jessica add a quote by Albert Schweitzer
item.description: "Until he extends the circle of his compassion to all living things, man will not himself find peace." -- Albert Schweitzer

item.title: Jessica add a quote by George Steiner
item.description: "We know now that a man can read Goethe or Rilke in the evening, that he can play Bach and Schubert, and go to his day's work at Auschwitz in the morning." -- George Steiner

item.title: Jessica add a quote by Bernard Berenson
item.description: "Consistency, commonly thought of as a good thing, requires you to be as ignorant today as you wre a year ago." -- Bernard Berenson

item.title: Jessica add a quote by Gertrude Stein
item.description: "If you are too careful, you are so occupied in being careful that you are sure to stumble over something." -- Gertrude Stein

item.title: Jessica add a quote by Andy Kessler
item.description: "There are a lot of dead carcasses on the road, and the vultures are out sniffing. This is the cycle of Wall Street. When bubbles crash, you get the value guys who come in and say, 'This thing is cheap." -- Andy Kessler

item.title: Jessica add a quote by Emily Dickinson
item.description: "Nature is a haunted house--but Art--is a house that tries to be haunted." -- Emily Dickinson

item.title: Jessica add a quote by Martin Amis
item.description: "Life is made of fear. Some people eat fear soup three times a day. Some people eat fear soup all the meals there are. I eat it sometimes. When they bring me fear soup to eat, I try not to eat it, I try to send it back. But sometimes I'm too afraid to and have to eat it anyway." -- Martin Amis

item.title: Jessica add a quote by J.G. Ballard
item.description: "I believe in the power of the imagination to remake the world, to release the truth within us, to hold back the night, to transcend death, to charm motorways, to ingratiate ourselves with birds, to enlist the confidences of madmen." -- J.G. Ballard

item.title: Jessica add a quote by Rudolf Arnheim
item.description: "Nothing is more humbling than to look with a strong magnifying glass at an insect so tiny that the naked eye sees only the barest speck and to discover that nevertheless it is sculpted and articulated and striped with the same care and imagination as a zebra. Apparently it does not occur to nature whether or not a creature is within our range of vision, and the suspicion arises that even the zebra was not designed for our benefit." -- Rudolf Arnheim

item.title: Jessica add a quote by Kenneth Patchen
item.description: "God must have loved the people in power, for he made them so much like their own image of him." -- Kenneth Patchen

item.title: Jessica add a quote by Woody Allen
item.description: "I believe there is something out there watching us. Unfortunately, it's the government." -- Woody Allen

item.title: Jessica add a quote by Margaret C. Anderson
item.description: "My greatest enemy is reality. I have fought it successfully for thirty years." -- Margaret C. Anderson

item.title: Jessica add a quote by David Patterson, NY state governor
item.description: "The secret is how to adjust. I ask myself how am I going to fit into this world, and how am I going to do it without killing myself." -- David Patterson, NY state governor

item.title: Jessica add a quote by Kai Haaland, 15
item.description: "Divorce is bad for the environment. Parents split up, and have 2 households instead of just one..." -- Kai Haaland, 15
